# Feed me.(Change the parameters)
```{r}

rm(list=ls())

# ROIs in the order they appear in the .csv file 
roiList= c("ROI1","ROI2","ROI3","ROI4","ROI5","ROI6","ROI7","ROI8")

#"craddock24_145", "craddock24_168","craddock24_172","craddock24_222","craddock24_26","craddock24_62", "craddock24_80", "craddock24_98")

# Set pmod_lowerlim:pmod_upperlim
pmodRange= 1:11

# If you tested more than 1 pmod, then all of the pmod parameters of one type should be listed, followed by all of the pmod parameters of another type. Change n to represent which pmod you'd like to change. e.g., in Cyberball, 1: inclusion pmod; 2: exclusion pmod.
pmodNames=c("Increasing_Inclusion", "Increasing_Exclusion")
totalPmods=length(pmodNames)

#### LOAD DATA ####
# Set working directory to where marsbar ROI summary time course .csv files are kept
setwd("/Volumes/TDS/nonbids_data/derivatives/fMRI/parcellations/cyb/tds2_N69/")

# Load file - NEED TO CREATE THE SUMMARY TIME COURSE FILE!
df.raw<-read.csv("summary_F_conj_pmod_flexi_craddock.csv", header=FALSE)
```

# Organize data
```{r}

# Label the rows and columns
colnames(df.raw)=roiList # label each column with the ROI
df.raw$SID=subjectList # add the list of SIDs
df.raw$pmod <- rep(pmodNames, length(subjectList)) # for a flexi-factorial model, use length(subjectList); for a standard model, use each=length(subjectList)
df.raw = df.raw %>% gather(ROI1, ROI2, ROI3, ROI4, ROI5, ROI6, ROI7, ROI8, key=roi, value=param)

df.avg = df.raw %>% group_by(pmod, roi) %>% summarize(mean=mean(param), sem=sd(param)/sqrt(length(subjectList)))
```

# Graph pmods
```{r}

# Set up a null dataframe called df.graph for summarizing plot parameters
df.graph=as.data.frame(matrix(rep(NA, length(pmodRange)*(totalPmods+1)), nrow=length(pmodRange), ncol=(totalPmods+1)))
colnames(df.graph)=c("pmodRange",pmodNames)
df.graph$pmodRange=pmodRange
df.avg$pmod=as.factor(df.avg$pmod)
df.avg$roi=as.factor(df.avg$roi)
  
# Populate df.graph and graph each pmod for each ROI
for (i in 1:length(roiList)) {
  for (j in 1:totalPmods) {
    df.graph[,j+1]=(filter(df.avg, roiList==roiList[i] & pmod== pmodNames[j])$mean) * pmodRange
  }
    print(ggplot(df.graph, aes(x = pmodRange)) +
          geom_line(aes(y = Increasing_Inclusion, colour = "to participant (inclusion)"),size=2) +
          geom_line(aes(y=Increasing_Exclusion, colour = "not to participant (exclusion)"),size=2) + 
          scale_color_manual("", breaks = c("to participant (inclusion)","not to participant (exclusion)"),values = c("to participant (inclusion)"="#9999CC","not to participant (exclusion)"="#66CC99")) + 
          scale_x_continuous(name="Increasing Throws", breaks=seq(-4,12,2)) +
          scale_y_continuous(name="Signal", limit = c(-2,2)) + #heme(axis.text=element_text(size=24)) + #axis.title=element_text(size=28), egend.text=element_text(size=28), legend.position="bottom") +
          scale_size_manual(values=c(1,4)) +
          ggtitle(roiList[i]) +
          guides(colour = guide_legend(nrow=2,byrow=TRUE)))
    
    print(ggplot((filter(df.avg, roi==roiList[i])), aes(x=pmod, y=mean, fill=pmod)) + 
            geom_bar(stat="identity", aes(fill=pmod)) +
            geom_errorbar(aes(ymin=mean-1.96*sem, ymax=mean+1.96*sem), width=.3) +
            ggtitle(paste("Mean beta estimates by condition for ROI", roiList[i], sep=" ")) +
            guides(fill=FALSE) +
            scale_fill_manual(breaks=c("Increasing_Inclusion", "Increasing_Exclusion"), values= c("Increasing_Inclusion"="#9999CC","Increasing_Exclusion"="#66CC99")) +
              #breaks = c("Increasing_Inclusion","Increasing_Exclusion"),values =  + 
            facet_grid(.~roi) +
            labs(x="Conditions", y="Mean beta estimates"))
}

```
